content: Do we have a template for Australian FHIR IGs?
it doesn't use a template right now.

@Brett Esler has been working on migrating to the external template approach, in a dev branch "dev-stdtemplate" on au-fhir-base, with its ig.ini currently pointing to fhir.base.template, as a starting point just to get the migration working. I'm sure that an Australian FHIR IG template would be most welcome.
See https://github.com/hl7au/au-fhir-base/blob/dev-stdtemplate/ig.ini
i'll commit a basic AU template pair soon.
ok. I committed one. It still needs work, but the package id to use is hl7.au.fhir.template
I have configured this in my R4 project, image.png
Yes. it still needs some polish but good that you got this far
I get an error when I try to uuse it: http://build.fhir.org/ig/aehrc/primary-care-data-technical/branches/master/failure/build.log
oh interesting. I'll have to add it to the trusted list.
ping me when done & I'll try again...

Grahame Grieve said:

Yes. it still needs some polish but good that you got this far

Yeah, I tried to fix this cosmetic issue in my local but no luck so far. if I take the template from 'hl7.fhir.template' and just replace the au logo, it's rendering properly in my local, but not able to make the image aligned with the code taken from : https://github.com/hl7au/hl7.au.fhir.template. I'll keep digging :slight_smile:

@Brett Esler , @Grahame Grieve I was finally able to fix the cosmetic issues:
I have noticed the following issues with it:
Location: https://github.com/hl7au/hl7.au.fhir.template/blob/master/includes/_append.fragment-header.html
Issue: href="http://hl7.org.au/fhir/search" the link is non-existent. Is there a plan to create that link? else we can use href="http://www.hl7.org/fhir/search.cfm"

Location: https://github.com/hl7au/hl7.au.base.template/blob/master/includes/_append.fragment-css.html
Issue: The file path: href="{{site.data.info.assets}}assets/css/hl7.au.css" doesn't exists. The name of the file in assets directory is: hl7-au.css. renaming the file to hl7.au.css works.

Applying the above mentioned fixes in our project's template, it works nicely.
image.png
I will have to work on search
